channel.title: Clustering on Tiny Little Things in Data Science
channel.description: Recent content in Clustering on Tiny Little Things in Data Science

item.title: Clustering on a Dissimilarity Matrix
item.description: Clustering is one of the well-known unsupervised learning tools. In the standard case you have an observation matrix where observations are in rows and variables which describe them are in columns. But data can also be structured in a different way, just like the distance matrix on a map. In this case observations are by both rows and columns and each element in the observation matrix is a measure of distance, or dissimilarity, between any two observations.
